name.description: Parameter name. Used when referencing parameter in workflows or inside command templating.
name.title: Name

anyOf.description: Will be displayed on the tool page as the label of the parameter.
Short bit of text, rendered on the tool form just below the associated field to provide information about the field.

If the parameter reflects just one command line argument of a certain tool, this tag should be set to that particular argument. It is rendered in parenthesis after the help section, and it will create the name attribute (if not given explicitly) from the argument attribute by stripping leading dashes and replacing all remaining dashes by underscores (e.g. if argument="--long-parameter" then name="long_parameter" is implicit).

optional.description: If `false`, parameter must have a value.
optional.title: Optional

ExpressionParameterValidatorModel.description:
Check if a one line python expression given expression evaluates to True.

The expression is given is the content of the validator tag.
ExpressionParameterValidatorModel.title: ExpressionParameterValidatorModel

hidden.description: If true, the output will not be shown in the history.
hidden.title: Hidden

anyOf.description: Output label. Will be used as dataset name in history.

hidden.title: Hidden

format.description: The short name for the output datatype.
format.title: Format

anyOf.description: This sets the data type of the output dataset(s) to be the same format as that of the specified tool input.

This copies the metadata information from the tool’s input dataset to serve as default for information that cannot be detected from the output. One prominent use case is interval data with a non-standard column order that cannot be deduced from a header line, but which is known to be identical in the input and output datasets.
Relative path to a file produced by the tool in its working directory. Output’s contents are set to this file’s contents.
anyOf.title: from_work_dir

items.description: Provide Javascript/ECMAScript 5.1 code here that will be available for expressions inside the `shell_command` field.
items.title: expression_lib

RegexParameterValidatorModel.description:
Check if a regular expression **matches** the value, i.e. appears
at the beginning of the value. To enforce a match of the complete value use
``$`` at the end of the expression. The expression is given is the content
of the validator tag. Note that for ``selects`` each option is checked
separately.
RegexParameterValidatorModel.title: RegexParameterValidatorModel

id.description: Unique identifier for the tool. Should be all lower-case and should not include whitespace.
id.title: Id

name.description: The name of the tool, displayed in the tool menu. This is not the same as the tool id, which is a unique identifier for the tool.
name.title: Name

description.description: The description is displayed in the tool menu immediately following the hyperlink for the tool.
description.title: Description

container.description: Container image to use for this tool.
container.title: Container

requirements.description: A list of requirements needed to execute this tool. These can be javascript expressions, resource requirements or container images.
requirements.title: Requirements

shell_command.description: A string that contains the command to be executed. Parameters can be referenced inside $().
shell_command.title: shell_command

license.description: A full URI or a a short [SPDX](https://spdx.org/licenses/) identifier for a license for this tool wrapper. The tool wrapper license can be independent of the underlying tool license. This license covers the tool yaml and associated scripts shipped with the tool.
license.title: License

help.description: Help text shown below the tool interface.
